Description: Fragment of flattened handle from a Thasian pottery transport amphora. Clay near fine micaceous light red-brown. Rectangular stamp at top of handle with Greek inscription and symbol of Herakles shooting.
Curator's comments: Names, Aristomenes (Thasian eponym) and Euryanax (Thasian fabricant). Garlan, Y., Les timbres amphoriques de Thasos. 1, Timbres protothasiens et thasiens anciens (Paris 1999) 318. Petrie diary, 1884-1885 (EES Archive XVII 47), p. 28, 18.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.0007)
